member.name: M:Xbim.IO.Memory.MemoryModel.LoadStep21(Xbim.IO.Step21.XbimP21Scanner)
member.summary: Core function which loads Step21 data. This override is schema aware and loads model factors based on the data.
member.param: Parser/Scanner
member.returns: Number of errors

member.name: M:Xbim.IO.Memory.MemoryModel.LoadZip(System.IO.Stream,Xbim.Common.ReportProgressDelegate)
member.summary: Loads the content of the model from ZIP archive. If the actual model file inside the archive is XML it is supposed to have an extension containing 'XML' like '.ifcxml', '.stpxml' or similar.
member.param: Input stream of the ZIP archive

member.name: M:Xbim.IO.Memory.MemoryModel.OpenReadStep21(System.String,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger,Xbim.Common.ReportProgressDelegate)
member.summary: Reads schema version fron the file on the fly inside the parser so it doesn't need to access the file twice.
member.param: Input step21 text file
Logger
Progress delegate
member.returns: New memory model

member.name: M:Xbim.IO.Memory.MemoryModel.OpenReadStep21(System.IO.Stream,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger,Xbim.Common.ReportProgressDelegate,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads schema version from the stream on the fly inside the parser so it doesn't need to access the file twice.
member.param: Input stream for step21 text file
Logger
Progress delegate
A list of ifc types to skip
Allow referenced entities that are not in the model, default false
When true, serialised file will maintain order of entities from the original file (or order of creation)
member.returns: New memory model

member.summary: Code to determine model specific workarounds (BIM tool IFC exporter quirks)

member.name: M:Xbim.IO.Xml.IfcXmlWriter3.Write(Xbim.Common.IModel,System.Xml.XmlWriter,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xbim.Common.IPersistEntity})
member.summary: This function writes model entities to the defined XML output.
member.param: Model to be used for serialization. If no entities are specified IModel.Instances will be used as a source of entities to be serialized.
Output XML

Optional entities enumerable. If you define this enumerable it will be used instead of all entities from IModel.Instances. This allows to define different way of entities retrieval like volatile instances from persisted DB model

members.member: Constructor of the reader for IFC2x3 XML. XSD is different for different versions of IFC and there is a major difference between IFC2x3 and IFC4 to there are two different classes to deal with this. x Delegate which will be used to create new entities Delegate which will be called once the entity is finished (no changes will be made to it) This is useful for a DB when this is the point when it can be serialized to DB Metadata model used to inspect Express types and their properties

member.name: P:Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlReader4.IdMap
member.summary: This can be used for analytical and file debugging purposes where relation between XML entity in the file and loaded entity needs to be kept.

members.member: Constructor of the reader for IFC2x3 XML. XSD is different for different versions of IFC and there is a major difference between IFC2x3 and IFC4 to there are two different classes to deal with this. x Delegate which will be used to getOrCreate new entities Delegate which will be called once the entity is finished (no changes will be made to it) This is useful for a DB when this is the point when it can be serialized to DB Metadata model used to inspect Express types and their properties A Logger

member.name: F:Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlWriter4._ns
member.summary: XML namespace

member.name: F:Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlWriter4._nsLocation
member.summary: XSD location URI

member.name: F:Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlWriter4._expressUri
member.summary: EXPRESS schema definition URI

member.name: F:Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlWriter4._configurationUri
member.summary: EXPRESS to XSD convertion configuration file URI

member.name: F:Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlWriter4._nsPrefix
member.summary: Namespace prefix

member.name: F:Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlWriter4._rootElementName
member.summary: Name of the root element

member.name: M:Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlWriter4.#ctor(Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlSettings)
member.summary: Constructor of the XML writer. This writer implements conventions for IFC4 XML and needs to get configuration with speficic cases like inversed inverses and other special cases. Default settings and configuration are for IFC4 Add1. If you pass configuration and settings make sure both are for the same schema definition.
member.param: Settings for writer like namespaces and root element name

member.name: M:Xbim.IO.Xml.XbimXmlWriter4.Write(Xbim.Common.IModel,System.Xml.XmlWriter,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Xbim.Common.IPersistEntity})
member.summary: This function writes model entities to the defined XML output.
member.param: Model to be used for serialization. If no entities are specified IModel.Instances will be used as a source of entities to be serialized.
Output XML

Optional entities enumerable. If you define this enumerable it will be used instead of all entities from IModel.Instances. This allows to define different way of entities retrieval like volatile instances from persisted DB model

member.name: P:Xbim.IO.Xml.XmlMetaProperty.AttributeSetter
member.summary: Delegate to be used to serialize value as an XML attribute. This has to be called BEFORE any nested elements are created.

member.name: M:Xbim.Ifc.ModelProviderExtensions.UseMemoryModelProvider(Xbim.IO.IModelProviderFactory)
member.summary: Configures the to use the
member.remarks: Note: The does not support all storage options. In particular it has no persistance mechanism except from storing back to IFC/IfcXml. If you require 'random access' without always holding the model in memory, another ModelProvider may be required. See Xbim.IO.Esent.HeuristicModelProvider.
member.param: The to configure
member.returns: The
